item.title: Species Distribution Modeling with HMSC
item.description: #TODO where did I get the Data from? #TODO add link to multispecies example Intro text To run this code you will need to install the pacman R package beforehand but this will take care of all the other packages required. pacman::p_load(abind, data.table, ggplot2, here, Hmsc, magrittr) We use the Finnish bird data that are also often used by the creators of HMSC to demonstrate the package (e.g. here and here).

item.title: About
item.description: Hugo is the world’s fastest framework for building websites. It is written in Go. It makes use of a variety of open source projects including: https://github.com/russross/blackfriday https://github.com/alecthomas/chroma https://github.com/muesli/smartcrop https://github.com/spf13/cobra https://github.com/spf13/viper Learn more and contribute on GitHub.
